Amazon is not the only major company looking to beef up its presence in Canada. Digital media streaming service Spotify is planning to follow Amazon's footsteps by hiring several hundred more employees in Canada, as well as Europe and Australia.

Lee Brown, Spotify's head of advertising business, said: "We are increasing our ads business marketing workforce by over 70 percent in Europe, Australia and Canada - and that's off a pretty sizable base."

He added: "We're investing in our advertising business. As far as long-term strategy, I think gone are the days of advertising being less than 10 percent of our overall revenue."

The company has more than 150 million paying subscribers and is looking to boost the money it makes from its 210 million ad-supported users.

Canada has become an increasingly popular option for companies looking to expand their operations as well as for highly skilled workers looking for opportunities.

Lucky for the workers, there are many pathways for tech workers to gain permanent residency in Canada. The global talent stream, skilled worker program and others are all designed to encourage highly skilled workers to put down roots in the Great White North.
